verses.kjv: I saw the LORD standing upon the altar: and he said, Smite the lintel of the door, that the posts may shake: and cut them in the head, all of them; and I will slay the last of them with the sword: he that fleeth of them shall not flee away, and he that escapeth of them shall not be delivered.
verses.web: I saw the Lord standing beside the altar, and he said, “Strike the tops of the pillars, that the thresholds may shake; and break them in pieces on the head of all of them; and I will kill the last of them with the sword: there shall not one of them flee away, and there shall not one of them escape.
verses.ct: I saw the Lord standing beside the altar, and he said, "Strike the tops of the pillars so hard that the thresholds shake. Shatter them down on everyone's heads. Anyone who survives, I will kill with the sword. Not one of them will escape. Not one will get away."

verses.kjv: Though they dig into hell, thence shall mine hand take them; though they climb up to heaven, thence will I bring them down:
verses.web: Though they dig into Sheol, there my hand will take them; and though they climb up to heaven, there I will bring them down.
verses.ct: "Even if they dig down to the depths of the grave, my hand will reach in and drag them out. Even if they climb up to heaven, I will pull them back down."

verses.kjv: And though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel, I will search and take them out thence; and though they be hid from my sight in the bottom of the sea, thence will I command the serpent, and he shall bite them:
verses.web: Though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel, I will search and take them out there; and though they be hidden from my sight in the bottom of the sea, there I will command the serpent, and it will bite them.
verses.ct: "Even if they hide on the peak of Mount Carmel, I will hunt them down and seize them. Even if they hide from me at the bottom of the sea, I will command the serpent there, and it will bite them."

verses.kjv: And though they go into captivity before their enemies, thence will I command the sword, and it shall slay them: and I will set mine eyes upon them for evil, and not for good.
verses.web: Though they go into captivity before their enemies, there I will command the sword, and it will kill them. I will set my eyes on them for evil, and not for good.
verses.ct: "Even if their enemies march them away as captives, I will command the sword to kill them there. My eyes are fixed on them — not to help them, but to destroy them."

verses.kjv: And the Lord GOD of hosts is he that toucheth the land, and it shall melt, and all that dwell therein shall mourn: and it shall rise up wholly like a flood; and shall be drowned, as by the flood of Egypt.
verses.web: For the Lord, LORD of Armies, is he who touches the land and it melts, and all who dwell in it will mourn; and it will rise up wholly like the River, and will sink again, like the River of Egypt.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD of Armies touches the earth and it melts. Everyone living on it mourns. The whole land rises like the Nile in flood, then sinks back down again like the river of Egypt.

verses.kjv: It is he that buildeth his stories in the heaven, and hath founded his troop in the earth; he that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD is his name.
verses.web: It is he who builds his rooms in the heavens, and has founded his vault on the earth; he who calls for the waters of the sea, and pours them out on the surface of the earth; LORD is his name.
verses.ct: He builds his upper chambers in the heavens and sets the dome of the sky over the earth. He summons the waters of the sea and pours them out across the land. The LORD is his name.

verses.kjv: Are ye not as children of the Ethiopians unto me, O children of Israel? saith the LORD. Have not I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt? and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Syrians from Kir?
verses.web: Are you not like the children of the Ethiopians to me, children of Israel?” says LORD. “Haven’t I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt, and the Philistines from Caphtor, and the Syrians from Kir?
verses.ct: "People of Israel, are you any different to me than the Ethiopians?" declares the LORD. "Didn't I bring Israel out of Egypt? But I also brought the Philistines from Caphtor and the Syrians from Kir."

verses.kjv: Behold, the eyes of the Lord GOD are upon the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the face of the earth; saving that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Behold, the eyes of the Lord LORD are on the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the surface of the earth; except that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Look — the eyes of the Lord GOD are on this sinful kingdom, and I will wipe it off the face of the earth. But I won't completely destroy the house of Jacob," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: For, lo, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all nations, like as corn is sifted in a sieve, yet shall not the least grain fall upon the earth.
verses.web: “For, behold, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all the nations, as grain is sifted in a sieve, yet not the least kernel will fall on the earth.
verses.ct: "I am giving the command, and I will shake the house of Israel among all the nations like grain shaken in a sieve — but not a single true kernel will fall to the ground and be lost."

verses.kjv: All the sinners of my people shall die by the sword, which say, The evil shall not overtake nor prevent us.
verses.web: All the sinners of my people will die by the sword, who say, ‘Evil won’t overtake nor meet us.’
verses.ct: "Every sinner among my people will die by the sword — the ones who say, 'Disaster will never catch up to us.'"

verses.kjv: In that day will I raise up the tabernacle of David that is fallen, and close up the breaches thereof; and I will raise up his ruins, and I will build it as in the days of old:
verses.web: In that day I will raise up the tent of David who is fallen, and close up its breaches, and I will raise up its ruins, and I will build it as in the days of old;
verses.ct: "On that day, I will rebuild David's fallen house. I will repair its broken walls, restore its ruins, and build it back up the way it was in the old days."

verses.kjv: That they may possess the remnant of Edom, and of all the heathen, which are called by my name, saith the LORD that doeth this.
verses.web: that they may possess the remnant of Edom, and all the nations who are called by my name,” says LORD who does this.
verses.ct: "Then they will take possession of what remains of Edom and of all the nations that bear my name," declares the LORD, who will make this happen.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that the plowman shall overtake the reaper, and the treader of grapes him that soweth seed; and the mountains shall drop sweet wine, and all the hills shall melt.
verses.web: “Behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that the plowman shall overtake the reaper, and the one treading grapes him who sows seed; and sweet wine will drip from the mountains, and flow from the hills.
verses.ct: "The days are coming," declares the LORD, "when the farmer will still be plowing as the harvester begins to reap, and the one crushing grapes will overlap with the one planting seeds. Sweet wine will drip from the mountains, and it will flow from every hill."

verses.kjv: And I will bring again the captivity of my people of Israel, and they shall build the waste cities, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and drink the wine thereof; they shall also make gardens, and eat the fruit of them.
verses.web: I will bring my people Israel back from captivity, and they will rebuild the ruined cities, and inhabit them; and they will plant vineyards, and drink wine from them. They shall also make gardens, and eat their fruit.
verses.ct: "I will bring my people Israel back from captivity. They will rebuild the ruined cities and live in them again. They will plant vineyards and drink the wine. They will plant gardens and eat the fruit."

verses.kjv: And I will plant them upon their land, and they shall no more be pulled up out of their land which I have given them, saith the LORD thy God.
verses.web: I will plant them on their land, and they will no more be plucked up out of their land which I have given them,” says LORD your God.
verses.ct: "I will plant them firmly in their own land, and they will never again be uprooted from the land I have given them," says the LORD your God.
